intro: Tetractomia solomonense, commonly known as the Solomon Islands starling plant, is a flowering plant native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
